Package pl.edu.agh.kis.pz1.util

Class PokerJudge

java.lang.Object
pl.edu.agh.kis.pz1.util.PokerJudge
public class PokerJudge extends Object
The PokerJudge class provides utility methods to judge poker game situations. It includes methods for deciding the winner between two players based on their card rankings and verifying whether the betting round has ended.

This class cannot be instantiated, as it is a utility class containing only static methods.

  • Method Details

    • decideWinnerBetweenTwoPlayers

      public static int decideWinnerBetweenTwoPlayers(List<Integer> cards1, List<Integer> cards2)
      Decides the winner between two players based on their card rankings. The cards are compared in order, and the player with the higher card wins. If the cards are equal, the next card is compared. If all cards are equal, the result is a tie (0).

      If cards1 is greater, player 1 is declared the winner (return value 1), and if cards2 is greater, player 2 wins (return value -1).

      Parameters:
      cards1 - a list of integers representing the card ranks of player 1
      cards2 - a list of integers representing the card ranks of player 2
      Returns:
      1 if player 1 wins, -1 if player 2 wins, 0 if it's a tie

    • verifyWhetherTheBettingEnded

      public static boolean verifyWhetherTheBettingEnded(List<Player> players, List<Integer> foldedPlayers)
      Verifies whether the betting round has ended for all players. The round is considered over if all non-folded players have placed the same bet.

      This method checks each player's bet and compares it with the current bet. If a player's bet differs from the current bet, the method returns false, indicating that the round has not ended. If all active players have placed the same bet, the method returns true.

      Parameters:
      players - the list of players in the current round
      foldedPlayers - the list of players who have folded and should not be considered
      Returns:
      true if the betting has ended, false otherwise
